greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows, finite differences of an array generated by an infinite product (Cf. A162506).
formula: Given the infinite product and array shown in A162506, we have
The array is a, a*b, a*b*c,... Finite differences of array columns = rows of the triangle, deleting the first "1".
example: taking finite differences from the top, then discarding the first "1",
results.author: _Gary W. Adamson_, Jul 04 2009
